intro: Pharnaceum lineare, commonly known as the linear pharnaceum, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, linear leaves and small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers. The plant is native to certain regions of southern Africa, where it thrives in moist, shaded environments. It is often found in woodland areas and along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it requires specific conditions to flourish.
